section.title: Cancel Post Dated Transactions
section.para: The Cancel Post Dated Transactions function allows post dated fund transfer requested to be cancelled.

section.title: Cancel Post Dated Transactions - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Cancel Post Dated Transactions function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Fund Transfers. Then select Cancel Post Dated Transactions from the left side navigation menu.
Alternatively, depending on the Cash Services function already selected, the link to the Cancel Post Dated Transactions function may already be available in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Cancel Post Dated Transactions - Options
section.para: The Cancel Post Dated Transactions function allows access to the Cancel Post Dated Transactions module provided by Cash Portal. In the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Fund Transfers page, a number of options are provided for Cancel Post Dated Transactions.
The following options are available for Cancel Post Dated Transaction.

listitem.para: Terminate an existing Post Dated Transaction.

section.title: Cancel Post Dated Transactions - Cancel Post Dated
section.para: When the Cancel Post Dated Transactions - Cancel Post Dated option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Fund Transfers page, it will display a list of all current Post Dated Transactions in the system.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Bank Ref, Beneficiary or Ccy fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of payments are the following:

Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the payment.
Bank Ref.
Identifier the bank uses for this payment.
Beneficiary
The Beneficiary of the payment.
Product Type
The type of recurring payment.
Ccy
The Currency of the LC.
Amount
The amount of the LC.
PAB
Is the Beneficiary an authorised, Pre Approved Beneficiary?
Transfer Date
The date of the next payment
Post Dated
Has the transaction been post dated? (Yes or No)
To select a recurring payment to be terminated, click on the System ID of the require payment and complete the termination details and click the terminate button.
